member.name: N:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000
member.summary: The namespace including all JPEG2000 codec classes, and JP2 specific metadata.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ByteOrder
member.summary: Byte order for input/output of image data.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ByteOrder.MachineNative
member.summary: machine native order. default

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ByteOrder.EndianBig
member.summary: big endian

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ByteOrder.EndianLittle
member.summary: little endian

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CacheOption
member.summary: Decompression internal read cache usage.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CacheOption.NoInternalCache
member.summary: not use internal cache.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CacheOption.UseInternalCache
member.summary: compressed data should be stored in internal cache. default.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CoderOptions
member.summary: Coder option bit masks. Flagged.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CoderOptions.AllPassTerminate
member.summary: only for decompression

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Colorspace
member.summary: External colorspaces - for input/output of image data

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CompressionMode
member.summary: Two compression modes are supported: using compression rates (CompressionSize) and quality (only when the 9-7 filter is used)

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CompressionMode.Size
member.summary: The maximum file size for lossy compression can be set. For rate 1:n, size = width * height * channels * bits_per_channel / 8 / n

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CompressionMode.Quality
member.summary: Compression to a particular quality is possible only when using 9-7 filter. A compression quality may be specified between 1 (low) and 100 (high). The size of reaulting Jpeg2000 file will depend of the image content.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2FileFormat
member.summary: Available JPEG2000 codestreams

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2FileFormat.Jpx
member.summary: JPEG2000 Part2 format file: *.jpf.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2FileFormat.Jp2
member.summary: JPEG2000 Part1 format file: *.jp2.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2FileFormat.Codestream
member.summary: JPEG2000 codestream: *.jpc, *.j2c, *.j2k.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2PacketMarkers
member.summary: Error recovery markers in bit stream. Flagged

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2PacketMarkers.Eph
member.summary: End of packet header

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2PacketMarkers.Sop
member.summary: Start of packet marker

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2PacketMarkers.None
member.summary: No packet markers

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Precision
member.summary: Wavelet Precision

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Precision.Force32Bit
member.summary: Force to use 32 bits.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Precision.Automatic
member.summary: Automatically use either 16 or 32 bit representation for wavelet coeff's. Default.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder
member.summary: For a given tile, the packets contain data from a specific component, a specific resolution, and a specific precinct. The order in which these packets are interleaved is called the progression order. The interleaving of the packets can progress along four axes: layer (L), component (C), resolution (R) and precinct (P).
member.remarks: The setting Lrcp is most useful when used with several layers. Pcrl should be used with precinct.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder.Cprl
member.summary: CPRL Color/channel progressive

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder.Pcrl
member.summary: PCRL Position progressive

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder.Rpcl
member.summary: RPCL Resolution then position progressive

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder.Rlcp
member.summary: RLCP Resolution then quality progressive

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ProgressionOrder.Lrcp
member.summary: LRCP Quality progressive

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle
member.summary: Quality styles are used to set the quality mode to be used during lossy compression. The quality may be optimized for PSNR or for visual quality. The visual quality may be optimized for viewing from small, medium and large distance.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualXXLarge
member.summary: Quality optimized for large viewing distance, large images, zoomed out views.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualXLarge
member.summary: Quality optimized for large viewing distance, large images, zoomed out views.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualLarge
member.summary: Quality optimized for large viewing distance, large images, zoomed out views.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualMedium
member.summary: Quality optimized for medium viewing distance.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualSmall
member.summary: Quality optimized for small viewing distance, small images, zoomed in views, OCR.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualXSmall
member.summary: Quality optimized for small viewing distance, small images, zoomed in views, OCR.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.VisualXXSmall
member.summary: Quality optimized for small viewing distance, small images, zoomed in views, OCR.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QualityStyle.Psnr
member.summary: Quality optimized for Psnr.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QuantizationStyle
member.summary: The quantization steps can either be derived from a base quantization step, Derived, or calculated for each image sub-band, Expounded.
member.remarks: Expounded style is recommended when using the irreversible filter.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QuantizationStyle.Expounded
member.summary: calculated for each image sub-band

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2QuantizationStyle.Derived
member.summary: derived from a bases quantization step

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ResolutionTypes.Capture
member.summary: For scan resolution

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2SpeedMode
member.summary: Values for setting the encoding speed.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2SpeedMode.Accurate
member.summary: Encoding speed mode.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2SpeedMode.Fast
member.summary: Encoding speed mode. Fast but lower quality. Default.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2WaveletFilter
member.summary: Wavelet filtering method.

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2WaveletFilter.NineSeven
member.summary: Irreversible filter

member.name: F:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2WaveletFilter.FiveThree
member.summary: Reversible filter

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.JpxStandardFeatures
member.summary: Standard Reader Requirement Features
member.remarks: The Jpx file format contains a box, the Reader Requirements box, specifying the features contained within the file. Many of these features, including the colorspace and existence of IP data, are set automatically by the library during compression. The following additional features are not automatically detected by the library and the JP2CompressSetFeature function may be called to add these features to the Reader Requirement box of a Jpx format file. The function JP2_Decompress_ContainsFeature can be used to check */ whether one of these features is found in a file. Details of additional */ features, including the colorspace and existence of IP data, can be */ obtained using Get Property from Jp2Decoder

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CieLabParams
member.summary: Extended parameters for the CIE L*a*b* color specification boxes

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2CieLabParams._ctor
member.summary: Constructor

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder
member.summary:
The class derives from
ImageDecoder and decodes JPEG2000 images.
member.remarks:
To add the ability to decode JP2 images, simply add an instance of the Jp2Decoder to the Decoders collection in the
RegisteredDecoders class. See the below example.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Jp2Decoder.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.GetImageInfo(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns information about a JPEG2000 image such as width, height, and bit depth.
member.remarks:
The returned ImageInfo must be cast to a
Jp2ImageInfo to access
FileFormat and
IpData properties.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.IsValidFormat(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified Stream is a JPEG2000 image.
member.returns: Returns true if the image is detected to be JPEG2000, otherwise returns false.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.Read(System.IO.Stream,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Decodes a JPEG2000 image from a stream and returns an AtalaImage with the decoded image data.
member.returns: Returns an AtalaImage containing the decoded JPEG2000 image.
member.param: A progress Delegate. Pass in null (Nothing in VB) to ignore progress events.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.ByteOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte order of the decoded data from one of little endian, big endian, or machine automatic.
member.remarks: Default value is Jp2ByteOrder.MachineNative.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.CacheOption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying whether the compress data should be stored in an internal cache.
member.remarks: The default value is Jp2CacheOption.UseInternalCache.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.EnableProgressiveDecompression
member.summary: Gets or sets a value enabling the ability to progressively decode the image.
member.remarks:
The default value is false. This setting when true causes the Decoder to raise the
ProgressiveImage event. That event can be handled to display the image at intervals defined in the
ProgressiveDecodeSteps property. Enabling progressive decoding does reduce performance, and is best suited for very large images, or streaming images over a network stream.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.Precision
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the precision of the wavelet coefficients.
member.remarks: Default value is Jp2Precision.Automatic. For improved efficiency, the library automatically, depending on the image depth, uses either 16 or 32 bit representation for wavelet coefficients. The use of 32 bit values may slightly improve image quality and the expense of speed and memory requirements.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.ProgressiveDecodeSteps
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of progressive decompression steps.
member.remarks:
The default value is 16. Depending on
ProgressionOrder in the
EncoderOptions property of the encoded source image, progressive output images will update either linearly (for PCRL, CPRL) or exponentially (otherwise). ProgressiveDecodeSteps must be greater than 0. Be aware that the number of useful steps is related to the image dimensions and component size. Large numbers of steps add little benefit to smaller images. See
EnableProgressiveDecompression for enabling progressive reading.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.ScaleDown
member.summary: Gets or sets a factor that is used to scale downwards the image as it's decoded.
member.remarks: The default value is 1. Values must be a power of two. For example, a value of 2 will reduce the image data by 1/2. A value of 8 reduces by 1/8. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, etc...

member.name: E:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Decoder.ProgressiveImage
member.summary: Fired for each intermediate step when decoding an image progressively.
member.remarks:
See
EnableProgressiveDecompression to enable progressive reading.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder
member.summary:
The class derived from
ImageEncoder that encodes JPEG2000 images.
member.remarks:
To encode JPEG2000 images, invoke the
Save method of the Jp2Encoder or create an instance of a Jp2Encoder, and pass it into one of the save methods in an AtalaImage, Workspace, or
WorkspaceViewer object. To specify compression, set the
Compression property to a value between 0.0 and 100.0.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Jp2Encoder.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Jp2Encoder.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder._ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of a Jp2Encoder specifying the compression rate.
member.param: Compression rates ranging 0 (maximum compression) to 100 (lossless). Do not use 0 for maximum compression.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.GetEncoderOptions(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the encoder options for a specific tile and component.
member.remarks:
Override this method to set encoder options for a specific tile and component. This method by default will use the
EncoderOptions as specified in this Jp2Encoder class. Normally, this method does not need to be overriden.
member.param: index of tile counting from left-top

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.Save(System.IO.Stream,Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaImage,Atalasoft.Imaging.ProgressEventHandler)
member.summary: Encodes an AtalaImage into the specified stream as a JPEG2000 image.
member.remarks:
This method is invoked when using save methods in an AtalaImage, Workspace, or
WorkspaceViewer object. In the professional edition, an ICC color profile is stored with the image if the ColorProfile object of the AtalaImage object is set.
member.param: A progress Delegate. Pass in null (Nothing in VB) to ignore progress events

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets the compressed size of the image as a percentage of an uncompressed image.
member.remarks: This property sets the maximum file size for lossy compression. In general the final size will be exactly the requested size or a few bytes lower. Compression may also be set to a percentage of quality (greater than 0 and less than or equal to 100). If Compression is set to 99, the image will be visually lossless. If the Compression is set to 100, the image will be numerically lossless.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.EncoderOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets encoder specific options that will be used by default for the entire image.
member.remarks:
If the
GetEncoderOptions is not overridden to supply specific encoder options for tiles or components, then this property will be used for encoder options for the entire encoded image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.EnhancedRegions
member.summary: Gets a collection of Enhanced Regions that can be set at a higher quality level than the rest of the image during compression.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.FileFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the file format to generate (JP2, JPEG2000 codestream, or JPX).
member.remarks: Default is Jp2. The JP2 and JPX format allow additional information, including resolution and meta-data, to be saved. The use of plain codestream is not recommended. The JPX file format is required to store CMYK and CIE Lab images as well as using unrestricted ICC profile. The codestream format requires the professional edition.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.IPData
member.summary: Gets or sets intellectual property rights data to be encoded with the image.The IP Data string.
member.remarks: Note that the IP data is not checked or parsed by the library. See ISO/IEC CD15444-1, Information technology - JPEG2000 image coding system, for more information.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.IptcTags
member.summary: Gets or sets IPTC data that will be stored in the encoded image.A collection of IptcTags.
member.remarks: IptcCollection is a collection of IptcTags defined in the Atalasoft.Imaging.MetaData namespace. Further details of the IPTC format may be found at www.iptc.org. IPTC data is stored in a UUID data block with a reserved IPTC UUID.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.Precision
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the precision of the wavelet coefficients.
member.remarks: Default value is Jp2Precision.Automatic. For improved efficiency, the library automatically, depending on the image depth, uses either 16 or 32 bit representation for wavelet coefficients. The use of 32 bit values may slightly improve image quality and the expense of speed and memory requirements.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.QualityStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the quality mode during lossy compression.
member.remarks: Default value is PSNR. For normal images (1:1 pixel display, up to 20 inches viewing distance) VisualSmall or PSNR is recommended. For technical and medical images, PSNR is recommended.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.ResolutionParams
member.summary: Set property for storing information of resolution. Refer to definition of Jp2ResolutionParams.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.SpeedMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the speed mode (Fast or Accurate) to use during lossy compression.
member.remarks: Default value is Fast. Fast provides high speed compression but may create images with a lower quality. Accurate produces optimal quality but slower speed.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.TileSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size in pixels of each individual tile.
member.remarks: An image can be split into smaller tiles, with each tile independently compressed. The basic tile size can be set using this property. Depending on the tile size specified by this property, tiling will be performed automatically inside library. To encode the image with just one tile, specify (0, 0) or Size.Empty for TileSize.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.UuidBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets UuidBox metadata to be stored in the encoded image.A collection of UuidBox objects.
member.remarks: This property holds UUIDs with associated data in a JPEG2000 format file. See ISO/IEC CD15444-1, Information technology - JPEG2000 image coding system, for more information.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.UuidInfoBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets UuidInfoBox metadata to be stored in the encoded image.A collection of UuidInfoBox objects.
member.remarks: This property associates a URL with a list of UUIDs. The URL points to information describing the usage and format of the listed UUIDs. See ISO/IEC CD15444-1, Information technology - JPEG2000 image coding system, for more information.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.WriteTileLengthMarker
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if a tile length marker is written to the encoded image.
member.remarks: Default value is false. The efficiency of decoding regions in a tiled image may be improved by the usage of tile length markers. Tile length markers contain the position of each tile in the JPEG2000 code stream, enabling faster access to tiled image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2Encoder.XmlBoxes
member.summary: Gets or sets XML metadata to be stored with the image.
member.remarks: In Jp2 format file, note that the XML data is not checked for XML compliance or parsed by the library. Adobe XMP data can be stored in this box. See ISO/IEC CD15444-1, Information technology - JPEG2000 image coding system, for more information.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions
member.summary: This class specifies encoder options that can be applied to the entire image, a specific tile, or a specific component.
member.remarks:
See the
EncoderOptions property in the
Jp2Encoder to set these options for the entire encoded image. To specify different options for different tiles or components, override the
GetEncoderOptions method in the Jp2Encoder class. QualityLayer, ProgressionOrder, and PacketMarkers are the options which can be set for each tile. WaveletFilterMethod, WaveletLevels, QuantizationStyle, codeBlockSize, and coderOptions are the options which can be set for each component in a given tile.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Jp2EncoderOptions.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.CodeBlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the blocks of coded data.
member.remarks: The default value is 64 x 64. Smaller code blocks can aid the decoding of regions of an image and error resilience. A code block may contain no more than 4096 samples, i.e. Size.Width Ã— Size.Height <= 4096. The code block can be set independently for each component in each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.CoderOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the coder options for faster compression / decompression.
member.remarks: The default value is Jp2CoderOptions.Predictable. These options may be combined to create error resilient JPEG2000 streams or for special codec (e.g. hardware coder) for a faster compression / decompression. These options will increase the file size slightly when generating a code stream with the same image quality. We recommend usage of Jp2CoderOptions.Predictable if fault tolerance is important. The coder options can be set independently for each component in each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.PacketMarkers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that creates special markers at the beginning and/or at the end of each block of a coded area.
member.remarks: Default value is Jp2PacketMarkers.Sop | Jp2PacketMarkers.Eph. These markers improve error resilience and improve the speed of decoding a region of an image. Packet markets can be set independently for each component in each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.ProgressionOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the organization of the coded data.
member.remarks: Default value is LRCP. The setting LRCP (quality) is most useful when used with several layers. PCRL (position) should be used with precincts. This value can be independently set for each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.QualityLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of quality layers in the code stream for use with progressive decoding.
member.remarks: Supports from 1 to 31 quality layers. A higher number of quality layers results in a finer progressive quality improvement. The number of layers can be set for each individual tile. This value can be independently set for each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.QuantizationStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the quantization steps.
member.remarks: The default value is Jp2QuantizationStyle.Expound. Note that this property may only be set when the irreversible filter (Jp2WaveletFilter.WaveletNineSeven) is used. The quantization steps can either be derived from a bases quantization step (Jp2QuantizationStyle.Derived) or calculated for each image sub-band (Jp2QuantizationStyle.Expound). Expound style is recommended. Quantization style can be independently set for each component in each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.WaveletFilterMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets a value selecting reversible (WaveletFiveThree) or irreversible (WaveletNineFive) wavelet filters.
member.remarks: Default value is WaveletFiveThree. The wavelet filter can be set independently for each component in each tile.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EncoderOptions.WaveletLevels
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of wavelet transformation levels.
member.remarks: Default value is 5. Valid values are in the range 0 (no wavelet analysis) to 16. The memory requirements and compression time increase with the number of transformation levels. A reasonable number of transformation levels are in the range of 4 to 6. Wavelet levels can be set independently for each component in each tile.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion
member.summary: Region of interest in the JPEG2000 standard

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion._ctor
member.summary: Create an instance of R.O.I.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion.Rectangle
member.summary: ROI shall be compressed in a higher quality than the rest of image.
member.remarks: Maximum of 16 ROI may be defined.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection
member.summary: Regions of interest which shall be compressed at a different quality than the rest of the image. Summary description for Jp2RoiCollection.
member.remarks: This property sets a collection of Jp2RegionOfInterest objects which shall be compressed at a different quality than the rest of image. A maximum of 16 regions of interest may be defined. A detailed discussion of Jp2RegionOfInterest class is described in A.1.3.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection._ctor
member.summary: Create instance

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.Add(Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion)
member.summary: Adds a Jp2EnhanceRegion to the collection.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.CopyTo(Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the collection into an array.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.IndexOf(Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion)
member.summary: Returns the index in the collection that contains the given Jp2EnhanceRegion.
member.returns: Returns -1 if the object doesn't exist in the collection.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.Remove(Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegion)
member.summary: Remove the given Jp2EnhanceRegion from the collection.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.EnhancementLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the a value controlling the level of enhanced quality for the enhanced regions.
member.remarks: The enhancement factor must be an integer between 0 and 10, where 0 implies no quality enhancement and 10 implies maximal quality enhancement. The quality enhancement factor applies to all regions of interest. If this property is not set then the maximum quality enhancement will be used by default.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2EnhancedRegionCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the Jp2EnhancedRegion from the collection at the specified index. Enumerable.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ImageInfo
member.summary: This class derives from ImageInfo, and contains information about the JPEG2000 image such as width, height, and colordepth.
member.remarks:
To obtain information specific to JPEG2000 such as FileType and , the returned ImageInfo class must be cast to a
Jp2ImageInfo object.

member.param: The base ImageInfo class to apply properties from.

member.summary: Gets the JPEG2000 codestream of the source image data.

member.summary: Summary description for Jp2ProgressReadParams.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.Jp2ResolutionParams
member.summary: Resolution structure for DPI information. Note that resolution information may only be stored in Jp2 file format images. Plain codestream format images can not store resolution information. The image resolution is calculated by: [DPM] = ( xNum / xDenom ) * 10 ^ xExp

ProgressiveImage event is fired.

member.summary: The number of bytes read from the source stream

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.ProgressiveImageEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the decoding should be cancelled.
member.remarks: This value should be set to true in the event handler to stop loading the image.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.ProgressiveImageEventArgs.CurrentStep
member.summary: Gets or sets the current step of progressive decompression.

member.name: T:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox
member.summary: A UUID box contains vendor specific data other than that data defined within International Standard. There may be multiple UUID boxes within the file
member.remarks:
The existence of any UUID boxes is optional for conforming files. Also, any UUID box shall not contain any information necessary for decoding the image to the extent that is defined within International Standard, and the interpretation of the data in any UUID box shall not change the visual appearance of the image. All readers may ignore any UUID box.
----------------------------------Field Name Size (bits) Value----------------------------------UUID 128 variesDATA varies varies----------------------------------
See ISO/IEC CD15444-1, Information technology - JPEG2000 image coding system, for more information.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of UuidBox.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox._ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of UuidBox.

member.name: M:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox._ctor(Atalasoft.Imaging.AtalaInt128,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new instance of UuidBox.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets vendor specific data.
member.remarks: The format of this data is indicated by the value of the UUID field.

member.name: P:Atalasoft.Imaging.Codec.Jpeg2000.UuidBox.Uuid
member.summary: Gets or sets the UUID value associated with this UUID Box.
member.remarks: This field contains 1 16-byte UUID as specified by ISO/IEC 11578:1996. The value of this UUID specifies the format of the vendor specific data stored in the DATA field and the interpretation of that data.
